q: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
h:
“Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.
h:
“People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: In nature there is no alienation. Everything belongs.
h:
“In nature there is no alienation. Everything belongs.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
h:
“Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
h:
“The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: The spirit is beyond destruction. No one can bring an end to spirit which is everlasting.
h:
“The spirit is beyond destruction. No one can bring an end to spirit which is everlasting.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Love never keeps a man from pursuing his destiny.
h:
“Love never keeps a man from pursuing his destiny.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
h:
“Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.
h:
“Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: To be truly ignorant, be content with your own knowledge.
h:
“To be truly ignorant, be content with your own knowledge.” —
Zhuangzi

q: A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.
h:
“A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Fools resist. The wise embrace.
h:
“Fools resist. The wise embrace.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: To be able to forget means sanity.
h:
“To be able to forget means sanity.” —
Jack London

q: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.
h:
“Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.
h:
“If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: You are now, and you do become, what you think about.
h:
“You are now, and you do become, what you think about.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.
h:
“Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Man should fear never beginning to live.
h:
“Man should fear never beginning to live.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Evil is whatever distracts.
h:
“Evil is whatever distracts. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: There's more to life than being a passenger.
h:
“There's more to life than being a passenger.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening
h:
“We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening” —
Zhuangzi

q: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
h:
“If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.
h:
“If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.” —
Mark Manson

q: The quicker you let go of old cheese, the sooner you find new cheese.
h:
“The quicker you let go of old cheese, the sooner you find new cheese.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.
h:
“When you repeat a mistake, it is not a mistake anymore: it is a decision.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.
h:
“The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Conscience is a man's compass.
h:
“Conscience is a man's compass. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
h:
“The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.” —
Mark Twain

q: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
h:
“The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.” —
Celestine Chua

q: When it hurts - observe. Life is trying to teach you something.
h:
“When it hurts - observe. Life is trying to teach you something.” —
Anita Krizzan

q: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
h:
“If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
h:
“Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
h:
“The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Every drop in the ocean counts.
h:
“Every drop in the ocean counts. ” —
Yoko Ono

q: You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.
h:
“You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.” —
Unknown

q: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
h:
“If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The sun is new each day.
h:
“The sun is new each day.” —
Heraclitus

q: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
h:
“Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
h:
“When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.
h:
“Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven. ” —
Confucius

q: Bloom where you are planted!
h:
“Bloom where you are planted!” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.
h:
“Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.” —
Dogen

q: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
h:
“Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.” —
Coco Chanel

q: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
h:
“The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Everyday you can take a tiny step in the right direction.
h:
“Everyday you can take a tiny step in the right direction.” —
Unknown

q: No one has ever become poor by giving.
h:
“No one has ever become poor by giving.” —
Anne Frank

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.
h:
“Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
h:
“The destiny of man is in his own soul. ” —
Herodotus

q: Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.
h:
“Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
h:
“Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
h:
“The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: If you try, you might get exactly what you want. If you don't, you don't.
h:
“If you try, you might get exactly what you want. If you don't, you don't.” —
Unknown

q: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
h:
“Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
h:
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Everything you can imagine is real.
h:
“Everything you can imagine is real.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
h:
“There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.
h:
“You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind.
h:
“Human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind.” —
William James

q: The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.
h:
“The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.” —
Steve Harvey

q: We can have more than we've got because we can become more than we are.
h:
“We can have more than we've got because we can become more than we are.” —
Jim Rohn

q: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
h:
“All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.
h:
“Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: The only way out is through.
h:
“The only way out is through.” —
Robert Frost

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
h:
“Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
h:
“Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.
h:
“Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: The real art in learning takes place as we move beyond proficiency, when our work becomes an expression of our essence.
h:
“The real art in learning takes place as we move beyond proficiency, when our work becomes an expression of our essence.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.
h:
“Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.” —
Tony Robbins

q: A man, as a general rule, owes very little to what he is born with - a man is what he makes of himself.
h:
“A man, as a general rule, owes very little to what he is born with - a man is what he makes of himself.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
h:
“Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.” —
Peter Drucker

q: Each path to knowledge involves different rules and these rules are not interchangeable.
h:
“Each path to knowledge involves different rules and these rules are not interchangeable.” —
Barack Obama

q: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
h:
“Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
h:
“A minute's success pays the failure of years.” —
Robert Browning

q: People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.
h:
“People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.” —
Unknown

q: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
h:
“We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Those who are enlightened never stop forging themselves.
h:
“Those who are enlightened never stop forging themselves.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.
h:
“Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.” —
Unknown

q: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
h:
“There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Getting lost along your path is a part of finding the path you are meant to be on.
h:
“Getting lost along your path is a part of finding the path you are meant to be on.” —
Robin Sharma

q: We're responsible for everything that happens to us.
h:
“We're responsible for everything that happens to us.” —
Yanni

q: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
h:
“Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.” —
Dan Brown

q: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
h:
“The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:
“Confidence is the greatest friend.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
h:
“Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree. ” —
Martin Luther

q: Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.
h:
“Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Just get out and do it. You will be very, very glad that you did.
h:
“Just get out and do it. You will be very, very glad that you did.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
h:
“He who knows best knows how little he knows.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Power is not what we do but what we do not - hasty and unwise actions that we repeat every day and which ultimately bring us into trouble.
h:
“Power is not what we do but what we do not - hasty and unwise actions that we repeat every day and which ultimately bring us into trouble.” —
Robert Greene

q: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
h:
“Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.” —
Les Brown

q: You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.
h:
“You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.” —
Steve Harvey

q: It is our experiences that mold us into who we are...during times of adversity our true character will show.
h:
“It is our experiences that mold us into who we are...during times of adversity our true character will show.” —
Unknown

q: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
h:
“You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
h:
“Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected. ” —
George Washington

q: You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.
h:
“You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.
h:
“The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.
h:
“Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
h:
“Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
h:
“If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans. ” —
Woody Allen

q: What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.
h:
“What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.
h:
“Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
h:
“We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'
h:
“Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'” —
Brian Tracy

q: No one has ever become poor by giving.
h:
“No one has ever become poor by giving.” —
Anne Frank

q: You are your best thing.
h:
“You are your best thing.” —
Toni Morrison

q: Plants grow weak without wind.
h:
“Plants grow weak without wind.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
h:
“Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.
h:
“Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
h:
“The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.” —
Simon Sinek

q: A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
h:
“A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.
h:
“Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Being In The Present Means Tuning Out Distractions And Paying Attention To What Is Important, Now.
h:
“Being In The Present Means Tuning Out Distractions And Paying Attention To What Is Important, Now.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: To escape from the world means that one's mind is not concerned with the opinions of the world.
h:
“To escape from the world means that one's mind is not concerned with the opinions of the world.” —
Dogen

q: We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.
h:
“We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
h:
“Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: As long as a human being worries about when he will die, and what he has that is his, all of his works are zero.
h:
“As long as a human being worries about when he will die, and what he has that is his, all of his works are zero.” —
Kabir

q: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
h:
“Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Waste not fresh tears over old griefs.
h:
“Waste not fresh tears over old griefs.” —
Euripides

q: Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams.
h:
“Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.
h:
“If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.” —
Pema Chodron

q: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
h:
“First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.” —
Epictetus

q: Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.
h:
“Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.” —
Isaac Newton

q: Empty yourself of everything - let the mind become still.
h:
“Empty yourself of everything - let the mind become still.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Do not be so open-minded that your brains fall out.
h:
“Do not be so open-minded that your brains fall out.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.
h:
“Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: The final mystery is oneself.
h:
“The final mystery is oneself.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Being wrong opens us up to the possibility of change.
h:
“Being wrong opens us up to the possibility of change.” —
Mark Manson

q: If you don't break your ropes while you're alive, do you think ghosts will do it after?
h:
“If you don't break your ropes while you're alive, do you think ghosts will do it after?” —
Kabir

q: The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
h:
“Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.” —
John Eliot

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
h:
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —
Mark Twain

q: People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple.
h:
“People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
h:
“Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.” —
Richard Bach

q: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
h:
“The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Genius is the ability to act rightly without precedent - the power to do the right thing the first time.
h:
“Genius is the ability to act rightly without precedent - the power to do the right thing the first time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
h:
“Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
h:
“Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.” —
Alexander Pope
